title: Brussels Sprout Hash with Bacon, Hazelnuts, and Mint
summary: Brussels Sprout Hash with Bacon, Hazelnuts, and Mint might be just the side dish you are searching for. One serving contains 257 calories, 9g of protein, and 21g of fat. This recipe serves 8 and costs $1.32 per serving. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. A mixture of green onions, butter, brussels sprouts, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 63%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Brussels Sprout and Bacon Hash, Brussels Sprout and Bacon Hash with Fried Egg, and sweet potato, brussels sprout, and bacon hash.
instructions: Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp. Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons grease. Crumble bacon, and set aside.                                                                                                 Melt butter with reserved bacon grease in same skillet over medium heat. Add Brussels sprouts, hazelnuts, and green onions. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 7 to 10 minutes or until sprouts are slightly wilted and tender.                                                                                                 Season with kosher salt and pepper. Toss with crumbled bacon and mint just before serving.

steps.step: Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp.
Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons grease. Crumble bacon, and set aside.
Melt butter with reserved bacon grease in same skillet over medium heat.
Add Brussels sprouts, hazelnuts, and green onions. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 7 to 10 minutes or until sprouts are slightly wilted and tender.
Season with kosher salt and pepper. Toss with crumbled bacon and mint just before serving.
